intro: Culcitium paramense, commonly known as the Paramense Caltrop, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes aromatic herbs like parsley and carrots. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, spiny fruit that resembles a caltrop, a defensive adaptation to deter herbivores. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Culcitium paramense is often found in rocky or arid habitats, showcasing its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
